Title: Azure Developer CLI (azd) – April 2025
EnhancedContent:
This post announces the April 2025 release version 1.14.0 of the Azure Developer CLI (`azd` ). We invite you to join [our April release discussion on GitHub](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/discussions/5035).

This release is packed with new features and templates, so let’s get into it. Here’s what’s new with `azd` with the April release:

## New features

- [\[4939\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4939) – Automatically load environment values from root .env on `azd init`
. This change enhances the `azd init` command to utilize an initial `.env file` , allowing it to influence the initial state of the environment created during initialization.
- [\[4939\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4939) – Introduce `AZD_ALLOW_NON_EMPTY_FOLDER`
variable that bypasses warning about initializing template in a directory that isn’t empty.
- [\[4977\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4977), [\[4995\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4995) – New `azd init --up`
flag that runs `azd up` after initializing from a template. Thanks @LianwMS for the contribution!
- [\[4931\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4931) – `azd add`
support for Azure AI Search. Azure AI Search now appears as an option under the AI group (previously AI models) in the `azd add` menu.
- [\[4914\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4914) – `azd show`
support for all resources supported by `azd add` and display fully evaluated connection variables for resources without provisioning a host resource.
- [\[4874\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4874) – Provide shortcuts for `azd env set-secrets`
to directly use Key Vault created with `azd add` .
- [\[4953\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4953) – Support array of model `usageName`
for quota validation.
- [\[5008\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/5008) – Add support for Azure Container Apps environment domain and registry outputs.
- [\[4943\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4943) – `azd add`
support for existing resources (AI models, AI Search, Key Vault, Event Hubs, Service Bus, Storage).
- [\[5010\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/5010) – Support model usage name metadata for main `location`
Bicep parameter.
- [\[4929\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4929), [\[5010\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/5010) Improve location and quota validation for Azure AI Services resources.
- [\[4957\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4957), [\[4959\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4959), [\[4979\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4979), [\[4999\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4999), [\[5008\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/5008) – Support .NET Aspire 9.1 includes: Update deployment for Aspire services to fetch endpoints from WebApp; adding support for a bicep.v0 expressing secrets; Aspire self migration detection (removes migration alpha feature and make azd to autodetect when AppHost owns compute `env`
.); and support `userPrincipalId` injection for AppHost Migration mode for the logged in user for Aspire with AppHost migration mode enabled.

## Bug fixes

- [\[4966\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4966) – Fix `AZURE_OPENAI_ENDPOINT`
not showing in `azd add` preview.
- [\[4561\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4561) – Fix `azd up -e <env>`
so it uses the specified environment.
- [\[4960\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4960) – Fix simplified init failures to provision with detected databases and `alpha.compose`
off.
- [\[4929\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4929) – Improve quota check for Azure Cognitive Services accounts to require at least `2`
capacity units.

## Other changes

- [\[4794\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4794) – Upgrade to Go 1.24.
- [\[4960\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4960) – Use Standard SKU for Azure Service Bus.
- [\[4960\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4960) – Remove passing host settings through `main.parameters.json`
.
- [\[4972\]](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/pull/4972) – Remove unused core Bicep modules. Thank you for reporting the issue, [Wenjie Yu](https://github.com/zedy-wj)!
- [530](https://github.com/Azure/awesome-azd/pull/530) – Adding .NET Aspire as a tool in the list of tags on the awesome-azd gallery. Thanks for your contribution [Frank Boucher](https://github.com/FBoucher)!

## New templates

New templates this month include:

- [AZD-LoadTest](https://github.com/maartenvandiemen/azd-loadtest/) authored by [Peter De Tender](https://github.com/petender) and [Maarten van Diemen](https://github.com/maartenvandiemen)
- [LiteLLM in Azure Container Apps with PostgreSQL database](https://github.com/Build5Nines/azd-litellm) authored by [Build5Nines](https://github.com/Build5Nines)
- [Deploy your AI Application in Production](https://github.com/microsoft/Deploy-Your-AI-Application-In-Production) authored by [Mike Swantek](https://github.com/mswantek68), [Daniel Schmidt](https://github.com/dsmmmm), and [Seth Steenken](https://github.com/sethsteenken)
- [Getting Started with Agents Using Azure AI Foundry](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/get-started-with-ai-agents) authored by [Howie Leung](https://github.com/howieleung), [Nikolay Rovinskiy](https://github.com/nick863), and [Sophia Ramsey](https://github.com/sophia-ramsey)
- [Get Started with Chat Using Azure AI Foundry](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/get-started-with-ai-chat) authored by [Howie Leung](https://github.com/howieleung), [Nikolay Rovinskiy](https://github.com/nick863), and [Sophia Ramsey](https://github.com/sophia-ramsey)
- [Conversation knowledge mining solution accelerator](https://github.com/microsoft/Conversation-Knowledge-Mining-Solution-Accelerator) authored by [Malory Rose], [Blessing Sanusi], [Mark Taylor], and [Anish Arora]
- [Azure Language OpenAI Conversational Agent Accelerator](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/Azure-Language-OpenAI-Conversational-Agent-Accelerator) authored by [Sean Murray](https://github.com/murraysean) and [Yanling Xiong](https://github.com/ylxiongwork)
- [.NET 9 Web Application with Redis Output Caching and Azure OpenAI](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/azure-redis-dalle-semantic-caching) authored by [Catherine Wang](https://github.com/CawaMS)

Thank you to the template authors for your contributions!

Do you have an `azd` template you’d like to share with the rest of the community? You can learn how to with our [contributor guide](https://azure.github.io/awesome-azd/docs/intro).

## New to `azd`
?

Welcome! You can use azd from:

- Your terminal of choice on Windows, Linux, or macOS.
- Visual Studio Code or GitHub Codespaces by [downloading the extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-azuretools.azure-dev) from the Marketplace, or installing it directly from the extension view (`Ctrl`
+ `Shift`
+ `X`
for Windows or `Cmd`
+ `Shift`
+ `X`
for macOS) in Visual Studio Code.
- Visual Studio by [enabling the preview feature flag](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/introducing-the-azure-developer-cli-a-faster-way-to-build-apps-for-the-cloud/#visual-studio).
- You can learn more about the Azure Developer CLI from our [official documentation](https://aka.ms/azd).
- If you run into any problems or have suggestions, file an issue or start a discussion in the [Azure Developer CLI repository](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev). You can also try checking out our [troubleshooting documentation](https://aka.ms/azd-troubleshoot).
